title: Worked Solution
text:
We can calculate the wavelength of the light emitted using the formula:
$$E =  rac{hc}{\lambda}$$
Where:
- $$E = 4.9 	imes 10^{-19} J$$ (energy difference),
- $$h = 6.626 	imes 10^{-34} JÂ·s$$ (Planck's constant),
- $$c = 3.00 	imes 10^8 m/s$$ (speed of light),
- $$\lambda$$ is the wavelength in meters. 
 Rearranging the equation to solve for $$\lambda$$:
 $$\lambda =  rac{hc}{E}$$
 Substituting the known values: 
 $$\lambda =  rac{(6.626 	imes 10^{-34}) 	imes (3.00 	imes 10^8)}{4.9 	imes 10^{-19}}$$
 $$\lambda =  rac{1.9878 	imes 10^{-25}}{4.9 	imes 10^{-19}} = 4.057 	imes 10^{-7} m$$
 Converting meters to nanometers $$1 m = 10^9 nm$$:
 $$\lambda = 4.057 	imes 10^{-7} m 	imes 10^9 = 406 nm$$ 
 Thus, the wavelength of the emitted light is approximately $$	extbf{406 nm}$$.
